item.title: 'Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy': PM Modi - News18
item.description:
Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Date: January 04, 2025   Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

  • PM Modi spoke at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, celebrating rural India's resilience.
  • He highlighted increasing accessibility to healthcare services in rural areas.
  • An approximate Rs. 3 lakh crore in financial assistance has been provided to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme.
“During the COVID pandemic, the world doubted how Indian villages would tackle the crisis, but we ensured vaccines reached the last person in every village.” – PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks reflect ongoing government efforts to enhance rural infrastructure and economic stability, aiming for a 'Viksit Bharat' (Developed India) by 2047.

item.title: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know - News18
item.description:
Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 19:32 IST

Quick commerce platform Zepto is gearing up to file its initial public offering (IPO) draft papers by March or April 2025, according to a report by The Economic Times. The company has permission to relocate its base from Singapore to India ahead of the public listing.

  • A critical board meeting on January 19 will finalise aspects of the IPO, including the appointment of bankers and determining the IPO size.
  • Data on the grey market premium will be available once the IPO process starts.
  • Zepto will become the first quick commerce startup to go public if successful.
  • Zepto is transitioning to a marketplace model, registered as Zepto Marketplace in October 2024.
  • Zepto raised USD 350 million in funding in November 2024 and plans to expand to over 50 cities.
“Zepto reported a 120 per cent increase in operating revenue to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24.”

The IPO process marks a significant step for Zepto as it seeks to expand and solidify its position in the quick commerce market.

item.title: Rare celestial event: Moon flanked by Venus and Saturn in stunning alignment over India - India Today
item.description:
Moon flanked by Venus and Saturn in stunning alignment over India

Publication Date: Jan 4, 2025

Source: India Today

Stargazers across India are in for a dazzling treat as the Moon, Venus, and Saturn align in a rare celestial event tonight. This planetary conjunction offers a breathtaking view of these three celestial bodies converging shortly after sunset.

  • TheWaxing crescent Moon will shine alongside Venus and Saturn.
  • The alignment will be visible around 8:30 p.m.
  • No specialized equipment is needed to view this event.
  • Best viewed in areas with minimal light pollution.
  • Astrophotographers are encouraged to capture this rare alignment.
“Whether you’re an avid astronomer or a casual stargazer, tonight’s celestial display is an opportunity to reconnect with the wonders of the universe.”

Don't miss this unique opportunity to witness the beauty of our solar system, as this celestial event is part of a larger series of astronomical occurrences scheduled for January 2025.

item.title: With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots - The Indian Express
item.description:
With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Virat Kohli displayed strong leadership on the field during the Test match against Australia, stepping up as captain while Jasprit Bumrah dealt with a back spasm. Despite some initial missteps, Kohli managed the field positions and worked closely with bowlers to maintain pressure on the Australia batting lineup.

  • Kohli initially occupied the wrong slip position but quickly corrected it.
  • After Bumrah left the field, Kohli took over field placements and animatedly directed play.
  • He provided encouragement and strategic advice to bowlers like Prasidh Krishna and Mohammad Siraj.
  • Kohli celebrated the team's successes and maintained high energy throughout the innings.
“They are new boys. I know they should be given responsibility. But let them earn it.” - Rohit Sharma

Kohli's performance highlighted his experience and dedication, as he effectively managed the team's strategy even in Bumrah's absence.

item.title: Cooking garlic and onions at high heat can add trans fats to your meal; here's how - The Times of India
item.description:
Cooking Garlic and Onions at High Heat Can Create Trans Fats: Here’s What You Need to Know

Publication Date: 2023-10-01 Source: The Times of India

This article discusses the risks associated with cooking garlic and onions at high temperatures, which can convert beneficial compounds into trans fats, posing heart health risks.

  • Cooking garlic and onions above 140 °C may create harmful trans fats.
  • Trans fats are linked to serious health issues including heart disease.
  • Research shows that certain sulfur compounds in these vegetables contribute to the formation of trans fats when heated.
  • The World Health Organization advises keeping trans fat intake to less than 1% of total daily energy consumption.
“Release of TFAs under normal cooking conditions is expected to be minimal. Therefore, excessive caution is unnecessary,” states Dr. Honda.

Being mindful of cooking temperatures for garlic and onions can help reduce trans fat intake and promote heart health.

item.title: Family Health Centre rewards patients for lifestyle disease management - The Hindu
item.description:
Family Health Centre Rewards Patients for Managing Lifestyle Diseases

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: IST

This article highlights a unique reward program launched by the Government Family Health Centre in Purakkad to inspire patients to effectively manage lifestyle diseases such as diabetes and hypertension.

  • Seventy-year-old Gomathi Gopalakrishnan received a two-gram gold biscuit for controlling her hypertension through a healthier lifestyle.
  • The 'Patharamattu Arogyam' program rewards patients who maintain their health, with other winners also receiving gold and silver coins.
  • A total of 178 patients were eligible for the rewards based on their consistent management of their health.
  • The initiative aims to prevent complications related to lifestyle diseases by encouraging adherence to treatment and regular monitoring.
  • The program was well-received and is expected to continue in the future.
“I am very happy that my blood pressure is now normal. The ‘Patharamattu Arogyam’ programme was a huge motivation...” - Gomathi Gopalakrishnan

The Family Health Centre's proactive approach is crucial amidst the rising prevalence of lifestyle diseases, aiming to support patients in maintaining their health effectively.

item.title: Wife, her mother and brother get bail in case of abetting Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash's suicide - NDTV
item.description:
Bengaluru Techie Atul Subhash's Family Granted Bail in Suicide Case

Date: Today | Source: Bengaluru Court

The wife and in-laws of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash have been granted bail by a Bengaluru court in the abetment of suicide case against them following Subhash's suicide on December 9.

  • Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania and her family were accused of harassment leading to his death.
  • They had previously appealed to the Karnataka High Court for expedited bail proceedings.
  • Subhash left a video and a detailed note accusing his wife and her relatives of torturing him.
  • Nikita was arrested in Gurugram; her family members were arrested in Prayagraj.
  • The parents of Subhash are seeking custody of their grandson.
“My son was broken from inside... His suicide note mentioned that his parents be given custody of his child,” said Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father.

This case raises serious concerns about marital harassment and the mental health of individuals facing familial pressures.

item.title: Pant's blitz and Test cricket on warp-speed at SCG - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Pant's Blitz and Test Cricket on Warp-Speed at SCG

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Cricbuzz

Rishabh Pant played a remarkable innings against Australia at the SCG, scoring 61 runs off just 33 balls, showcasing a rapid approach to Test cricket on a challenging pitch.

  • Pant's explosive knock highlighted a day of fast-paced Test cricket where over 300 runs were scored.
  • The match saw a total of 15 wickets fall, indicating a day full of action and drama.
  • Virat Kohli faced a disappointing end in his final Test innings on Australian soil.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Siraj were instrumental in bowling early breakthroughs.
Pant was providing a blueprint to every other batter who'd take strike in Sydney for the reminder of the match.

The match showcased the unpredictability of Test cricket, as all outcomes remained possible heading into the climax of the series.

item.title: Kejriwal promises to waive 'inflated' water bills, if AAP wins Delhi polls - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal vows to cancel high water bills if AAP wins Delhi elections

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Arvind Kejriwal, the Chief Minister of Delhi, has promised that if his party, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), wins the upcoming elections, they will waive off inflated water bills that have burdened residents.

  • Kejriwal's pledge to address grievances about high water billing.
  • AAP aims to implement fair water pricing if re-elected.
  • Possible financial relief for numerous residents in the capital.
“Water is a basic necessity, and we cannot burden our citizens with inflated bills,” said Kejriwal.

This commitment is positioned as a key election promise aimed at securing voter support by tackling a pressing local issue.

item.title: HMPV outbreak in China: Telangana govt issues dos and don'ts — check details here | Today News - Mint
item.description:
HMPV Outbreak in China: Telangana Government Issues Guidelines

Publication Date: Saturday

Source: Live Mint

The Telangana state government has issued a set of precautionary measures amid rising concerns over an HMPV outbreak in China, although no cases have been reported in Telangana.

Key Points

  • The Telangana health department reported no significant increase in respiratory infections compared to the previous year.
  • Dr. Atul Goyal advised general precautions and noted the lack of alarm.
  • Common symptoms of HMPV include cough, fever, nasal congestion, and shortness of breath.
  • The government issued specific do's and don'ts for citizens to follow.

Do’s

  • Cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing.
  • Wash hands regularly with soap or sanitizer.
  • Avoid crowded places and maintain distance from sick individuals.
  • Stay home if feeling unwell.
  • Stay hydrated and consume nutritious food.

Don’ts

  • Do not reuse tissues or handkerchiefs.
  • Avoid close contact with sick individuals.
  • Steer clear of touching your face frequently.
  • Do not spit in public areas.
  • Avoid self-medication without professional advice.
“We are monitoring the situation in China. If an outbreak is detected that has the potential to spread to other areas, we can check its spread very quickly,” said Kerala Health Minister Veena George.

item.title: Biden to present Presidential Medal of Freedom to Hillary Clinton, George Soros and Lionel Messi - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Biden to Honor Hillary Clinton, George Soros, and Lionel Messi with Presidential Medal of Freedom

Published: 04 January 2025, 11:50 IST

President Joe Biden has announced the recipients of the prestigious Presidential Medal of Freedom, including Hillary Clinton, George Soros, and Lionel Messi, among others, to be awarded at a White House ceremony.

  • The Medal of Freedom is the Nation's highest civilian honor.
  • Other notable recipients include Ralph Lauren, Ashton Carter (posthumously), and Fannie Lou Hamer (posthumously).
  • Soros is recognized for his global initiatives supporting democracy and human rights.
  • Messi is acknowledged as a decorated soccer player and UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador.
  • The honorees are celebrated for their significant contributions to society and the world.
“These nineteen individuals are great leaders who have made America and the world a better place.” - The White House

This year’s ceremony highlights the exemplary achievements of individuals who have impacted the nation and the globe positively, reinforcing the values of decency and equality.

item.title: No HMPV cases in Telangana, says director of Public Health - The Hindu
item.description:
No HMPV Cases Reported in Telangana, Health Officials Assure Public

Published on: January 04, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Amid concerns about a Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) outbreak in China, Telangana health officials report no cases in the state, emphasizing public health safety measures.

  • Director of Public Health, B. Ravinder Nayak, ensures there are no reported HMPV cases in Telangana.
  • Ministry of Health assures that HMPV behaves like other respiratory viruses.
  • No significant rise in respiratory infections observed in December 2024 compared to 2023.
  • Guidelines issued to prevent respiratory infections.
  • Public urged to remain vigilant but not to panic.
“Citizens were urged to remain vigilant but not to panic, as all necessary measures are being taken to ensure public health safety.”

In conclusion, the Telangana health department continues to monitor the situation and has issued precautions to help prevent respiratory infections.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
item.description:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi Airport

Published: January 04, 2025 07:34 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The national capital experienced severe fog conditions, leading to significant disruptions at Indira Gandhi International Airport with over 300 flights affected.

  • Zero visibility for nine hours caused 335 flight delays, 41 cancellations, and 19 diversions.
  • Conditions affected not only Delhi but also Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, and several other northern states.
  • Delhi's visibility dropped to below 50 meters, impacting landings and departures.
  • IndiGo and Air India issued alerts regarding the disruptions due to dense fog.
  • CAT III compliant flights were less affected by the conditions.
“Dense fog continues to affect visibility in Delhi, Chandigarh, Srinagar, Guwahati and Patna even during daytime hours.” - IndiGo

This incident highlights the ongoing challenges of weather-related travel disruptions in major Indian cities.

item.title: Who is Edward Pettifer? Brit killed in New Orleans attack shared deep links to Royals as King Charles… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Edward Pettifer? Brit killed in New Orleans attack shared deep links to Royals as King Charles…

Date: January 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Edward Pettifer, a 31-year-old Brit, was tragically killed in a terrorist attack in New Orleans, which resulted in 14 fatalities. His familial connections to the Royal Family have come to light following this shocking incident.

  • Pettifer was identified as the stepson of Tiggy Legge-Bourke, the former nanny of Prince William and Prince Harry.
  • He succumbed to “blunt force injuries” after a pickup truck attack during a New Year’s party.
  • His family expressed profound grief, highlighting his role as a beloved son and friend.
  • King Charles reportedly expressed sadness and reached out to Pettifer’s family.
“We will all miss him terribly,” said Edward's family regarding their loss.

This horrific event not only resulted in a significant loss of life but also revealed deep ties between the victim and the British royal family, which has sparked widespread media coverage and public sympathy.

item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has indicated a distant approach from the ongoing farmers' protests led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, unlike the proactive measures taken during Modi's previous term.

  • Farmers have been protesting since February 2024 at the Punjab-Haryana borders, demanding legal status for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm debt waiver.
  • Chouhan has extended an open invitation for talks, yet has not engaged directly with the protesting farmers.
  • The government's previous attempts to resolve farmer grievances, particularly in 2020-21, led to escalated tensions and prolonged protests.
  • Current protests are more localized and lack the broad unity seen in earlier movements.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, president of BKU Sidhupur, is on a hunger strike demanding response to farmers' issues from the government.
“Currently, the Supreme Court is looking into this issue. Whatever directives the Supreme Court gives, will be followed.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

This current strategy marks a significant shift in the government's handling of farmer-related issues, emphasizing a more detached stance in contrast to previous direct engagements.

item.title: Firing in Lower Kurram leaves DC, policeman wounded - The Express Tribune
item.description:
Firing Incident in Lower Kurram Injures Deputy Commissioner

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Express News

A shooting targeting official vehicles in Lower Kurram, Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa has left Deputy Commissioner Javed Allah Mehsud injured. He is in stable condition and is being transferred to Peshawar for further treatment.

  • The attack occurred in the Baggan area when assailants opened fire on government vehicles.
  • Local authorities confirmed one police officer also sustained injuries.
  • Dr. Saif, a KP government advisor, reported that the DC's surgery is ongoing but his condition is stable.
  • President Zardari condemned the attack, emphasizing the need for unity to prevent chaos.
  • Calls made to avoid misinformation and ensure safety of all passengers.
“The elements behind this act of violence aim to create chaos and disrupt peace efforts in the region,” - President Zardari

This incident highlights the ongoing security challenges in the region and the importance of community unity and government response to maintain peace.

item.title: CISF jawan shoots himself dead at Surat Airport - The Times of India
item.description:
CISF jawan shoots himself dead at Surat Airport

Date: October 4, 2023 Source: Times of India

A tragic incident occurred at Surat Airport where a Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) jawan took his own life.

  • The incident happened early in the morning, causing shock among the airport staff.
  • The identity of the jawan has been disclosed, and further investigation is underway.
  • Authorities are looking into possible reasons leading to this tragic event.
"This is a distressing incident, and we will ensure a thorough investigation is conducted." - CISF spokesperson

This unfortunate event highlights the mental health challenges faced by security personnel.

item.title: 3 Soldiers Die As Army Vehicle Falls Into Gorge In Jammu And Kashmir - NDTV
item.description:
Three Soldiers Die in Army Vehicle Accident in Jammu and Kashmir

Date: Saturday Source: Srinagar

Three soldiers died after an Army truck skidded off the road and plunged into a gorge in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district. Bad weather contributed to the accident.

  • Incident occurred near the SK Payen area at around 2.30 pm.
  • The Army expressed gratitude towards Kashmiri locals for their assistance in evacuating injured soldiers.
  • Heartfelt condolences were offered to the bereaved families by the Army.
  • This incident follows another vehicle accident last month in which five soldiers died.
“Tragically three bravehearts lost their lives in the unfortunate accident. Indian Army extends heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families.”

The tragic loss of these soldiers highlights the dangers faced by military personnel in challenging weather conditions.

item.description:
With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Virat Kohli displayed strong leadership on the field during the Test match against Australia, stepping up as captain while Jasprit Bumrah dealt with a back spasm. Despite some initial missteps, Kohli managed the field positions and worked closely with bowlers to maintain pressure on the Australia batting lineup.

  • Kohli initially occupied the wrong slip position but quickly corrected it.
  • After Bumrah left the field, Kohli took over field placements and animatedly directed play.
  • He provided encouragement and strategic advice to bowlers like Prasidh Krishna and Mohammad Siraj.
  • Kohli celebrated the team's successes and maintained high energy throughout the innings.
“They are new boys. I know they should be given responsibility. But let them earn it.” - Rohit Sharma

Kohli's performance highlighted his experience and dedication, as he effectively managed the team's strategy even in Bumrah's absence.

item.title: No need to worry over reports of China flu outbreak: Kerala health minister - Business Standard
item.description:
No need to worry over reports of China flu outbreak: Kerala health minister

Date: Jan 04 2025 | Source: Press Trust of India, Thiruvananthapuram

Kerala Health Minister Veena George addresses concerns regarding the outbreak of viral infections in China, assuring that there is no need for public panic as they monitor the situation closely.

  • George stated there have been no reports of a pandemic-causing virus from China.
  • Extra caution is advised for vulnerable groups like pregnant women, children, and the elderly.
  • The National Centre for Disease Control is monitoring the situation and coordinating with international agencies.
  • Health officials describe the Human Metapneumovirus as comparable to common respiratory viruses.
"We are monitoring the situation in China. If an outbreak is detected that has the potential to spread to other areas, we can check its spread very quickly." - Veena George

The Kerala government is taking preventive measures and remains vigilant in response to reports from China, emphasizing the importance of awareness and health safety.

item.title: Who was R Chidambaram, scientist involved in 1974 'Op Smiling Buddha', Pokhran tests? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who was R Chidambaram, scientist involved in 1974 'Op Smiling Buddha', Pokhran tests?

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rajagopala Chidambaram, a prominent physicist and leader in India's nuclear program, passed away at age 88 on January 4, 2025. He is celebrated for his roles in both the 1974 'Smiling Buddha' and the 1998 Pokhran-II tests, which confirmed India's status as a nuclear power.

  • Chidambaram served as Principal Scientific Adviser (2001–2018) and director of Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (1990-1993).
  • His contributions helped advance India's nuclear capabilities and scientific research, impacting sectors like energy and healthcare.
  • He was recognised with honors such as the Padma Shri (1975) and Padma Vibhushan (1999) for his work.
  • Chidambaram's research greatly influenced materials science and high-pressure physics in India.
“His unparalleled contributions to India's scientific and strategic capabilities and his visionary leadership in science and technology will forever be remembered.” - Department of Atomic Energy

R. Chidambaram's legacy is marked by his dedication to scientific excellence and national progress in nuclear technology.
